intro: Amsinckia jucunda, commonly known as the sticky leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, sticky leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, dandelion-like seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Amsinckia jucunda is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
